clinical_study.brief_title: A New Approach to a Personalized Patient Blood Management Program (pPBM) in Total Hip Arthroplasty (THA)
clinical_study.official_title: A New Approach to a Personalized Patient Blood Management Program in Total Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock:
The study evaluates the patient related risk and predictive factors concerning perioperative homologous blood cell transfusion (erythrocyte concentrate ) in THA patients in one EndoCert max-certified orthopedic hospital in Germany.
A patient oriented preoperative decision-making algorithm (a personalised Patient Blood Management or pPBM App) will be developed as a new patient-safety blood-sparing strategy.
The aim is to increase the patient safety by using the pPBM App and to reach a more efficient management of resources.

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospective audit of 470 consecutive primary THA in 2013 and 2014

primary_outcome.measure: Events and circumstances of Homologous Blood Transfusion (erythrocyte concentrate transfusion)
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 10 days
primary_outcome.description: Multivariate analysis of predictive variables like age, sex, BMI, hip and belly circumference, chronic kidney disease, chronic cardio-vascular disease, chronic inflammatory disease, diabetes mellitus, cancer, ASA Score, cemented, hybrid or not cemented prosthesis, surgery duration, medication and hemoglobin level before surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 10 days
secondary_outcome.description: Introducing the pPBM App as a safe blood-sparing strategy

study_pop.textblock: Patients who electively underwent primary THA in 2013 and 2014

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primary THA on patients with coxarthrosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- any kind of old or acute fractures about the basin and hip
- combined surgery, like first extracting a femur nail and than undergoing THA
- any other kind of combined or simultaneous surgery
- any kind of coagulopathy
